results.title: The Volunteer Youth Program
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scollo, Open Channel Productions and Jack White
results.brief_description: Highlights the depressing effect that prolonged unemployment can have upon a young person’s self-confidence and that involvement in community work can provide an opportunity for people between jobs to exercise a sense of choice in their career. Explains the resources of the Volunteer Youth Program providing a sample of the range of activities - theatre, public radio and child care.

results.title: Up against it
results.creator_credit: Henley Beach Mural Collective and Cath Cantlon
results.brief_description: A documentary on the painting of a large mural on a sea wall at Adelaide’s Henley Beach. Shows the design considerations, research, the process of involving the local council and school students, and the preparation and painting of the wall.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Henley Beach Mural Collective and Cath Cantlon

results.title: Social security benefits: right or privilege?
results.creator_credit: David Gardner, Centre for Study of Higher Education, University of Melbourne and Roger Ley
results.brief_description: Outlines the work of a field officer with the Commonwealth Department of Social Security. Shows how the evidence found by the field officer can determine the continuation or cessation of a benefit. See also “Branda’s appeal”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Gardner, Centre for Study of Higher Education, University of Melbourne and Roger Ley

results.title: Two Australias
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Diane O'Connor
results.brief_description: Examines income distribution in Australia, comparing the attitudes of some wealthy and successful business people with those on social security benefits.

results.brief_description: Contains two programs that explain how to handle overhead projection equipment and how to produce OHP transparencies

results.title: Primary media studies
results.creator_credit: Film Media Studies, Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Stephen Skok
results.brief_description: Indicates various types of activities that could be included in a primary media studies course. Shows hand drawing on film, making storyboards, exercises in persistence of vision, stimuli for creative writing, drama with video and script development.

results.title: Open doors ... opportunities in trade training for women
results.brief_description: Interviews with women apprentices show the opportunities in various trades; they are training to be nursery attendants, motor mechanics, plumbers, refrigeration mechanics, and optical glass makers. They speak about career prospects, work satisfaction and attitudes towards female apprentices. No other credits available.
results.title_for_label: Open doors … opportunities in trade training for women

results.title: Through a looking glass; Drama is -
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Vincent O'Donnell
results.brief_description: Two drama education programs: “Through a looking glass” shows the major concepts underlaying drama in education and how the teacher can participate with the student in the dramatic process. “Drama is -” explores the ways in which drama can be used as a method to teach many subject areas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Vincent O’Donnell

results.title: Getting into jeans
results.creator_credit: AVCOM Productions, Ross D Wylie, Chris Strange and Paul Wingate
results.brief_description: Graeme (Shirley) Strachan presents an overview of the production of a pair of jeans from the beginning of the design process through to the sale to the customer. Shows the function of computers in laying out pattern pieces to the material available, the machinist at work, and the activity of wholesalers and retailers.

results.title: Making your mind up
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development, George Cass and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: Indicates the wide application of word processors in office environments and the sorts of prerequisites the personnel officers seek when interviewing applicants for typing and word processing positions.
